snippet: Rafael Caro Quintero was the mastermind of the 1985 killing of Agent Enrique Camarena and two other Americans and served 28 years of a 40-year sentence.
abstract: United States formally asks Mexico to re-arrest drug kingpin Rafael Caro Quintero, who was released from prison despite his conviction for masterminding the 1985 murder of American drug agent Enrique Camarena and two others and served 28 years of 40-year sentence.

byline.original: By PETER BAKER and RANDAL C. ARCHIBOLD
byline.contributor: Peter Baker reported from Washington, and Randal C. Archibold from Mexico City. Karla Zabludovsky contributed reporting from Mexico City.

lead_paragraph: Rafael Caro Quintero was the mastermind of the 1985 killing of Agent Enrique Camarena and two other Americans and served 28 years of a 40-year sentence.

headline.main: U.S. Seeks Arrest of Mexican Kingpin Who Was Freed in American’s Murder
headline.print_headline: U.S. Asks for Arrest of Mexican Kingpin Who Was Freed in American’s Murder
